Improve this resume bullet:
""Custom Cabinet and Cabinet Refacing company needs a person to do renderings for sales opportunities and new projects. A typical job will be starting with photos and measurements on an existing space and creating a rendering to show the customer the proposed cabinet solution. You will work from inspiration photos to create the rendering for the customer. You must be familiar with US kitchen cabinet designs and styles.. Many of the renderings will be initial conceptual drawings and do not need to be photorealistic. Some of the renderings will need to be detailed with specific door designs and other exact design details. We have an initial requirement to deliver a conceptual drawing in two days from starting.This is expected to be repeating work with 2 or 3 projects per month needing renderings.Hourly Range: $10.00-$30.00Posted On: February 14, 2024 03:54 UTCCategory: 3D Modeling & RenderingSkills:3D Rendering, Interior Design, SketchUpSkills: 3D Rendering, Interior Design, SketchUpCountry: United States""

Improve this resume bullet:
""Creative cover art needed!!I'm currently writing a short story series to be released on Kindle Vella called Dark Matter. The genre of the collection is Sci-Fi/Horror with a spin on technology in almost all of the stories - similar to Black Mirror or Twilight Zone. Kindle Vella only requires one image without text that will be cropped into a circle. Must be a JPG with 1600 x 1600 dimensions and not exceed 2 MB in file size.I'm looking for a creative image that will show a man sitting at a work desk (basically an author writing stories) with his face as a black hole instead of a human face. Maybe papers, pencil, VR headset, and other objects are flying around in the air around him. The idea is these stories are spilling out of my head that's actually a black hole. It should appear comical but also dark at the same time. Since the image will be cropped into a circle, the main elements should be closer to the center of the image. I've copied a few examples of other cover art on Kindle Vella to give you an idea of how it's crops. Bonus points if you can create some symmetry between the black hole and the circle crop.Please provide examples of your past work, especially if you have unique styles that you think would fit this project. The image you provide must not be created by any artificial intelligence generative software.Budget: $50Posted On: February 14, 2024 03:54 UTCCategory: Graphic DesignSkills:Graphic Design, Cover Art Design, Concept Artistry, Drawing, IllustrationSkills: Graphic Design, Cover Art Design, Concept Artistry, Drawing, IllustrationLocation Requirement: Only freelancers located in the United States may apply.Country: United States""
Delivered creative, cover, art-based improvements by transforming ad-hoc tasks into repeatable, automated processes that improved productivity and accuracy for clients.

""Imagine our store is like a big digital warehouse, similar to those quick delivery services like Amazon, Getir, Gorillas, and JOKR, where customers use an app to order what they need, and we deliver it super fast. To make sure we always have what people want without ending up with piles of things nobody buys, we use data—lots of it.Data helps us predict exactly what to stock up on. We do this by keeping track of everything happening on our app. For that, we use a tool called Mixpanel, which is like putting tiny sensors all over the app. These sensors tell us:* What products people are looking at by recording every time someone clicks on an item.* How popular each product is by counting the clicks and how often they're added or removed from shopping carts.* Where each product is popular, so we can map out the best-sellers in every city.* Where our users are, pinpointing the cities they come from.* When our app gets the most action, like the busiest times for views, cart adds, and clicks.We also want to know our customers as if they're friends. This means for every user, say John, we'll know:* His location, contact details, and what he likes to buy the most.* How much time he spends browsing different categories.* His shopping habits—what days and times he usually buys, how much he spends monthly and in total.* His app activity—how long he spends on the app, when he's most active, and how quickly he makes decisions to add things to his cart and check out.All of this information needs to be easy to understand at a glance, which is why we'll use charts and visuals to display it.Hourly Range: $20.00-$35.00Posted On: February 16, 2024 18:46 UTCCategory: Data EngineeringSkills:Data Engineering, Data Analysis Consultation, Mixpanel, Data AnalysisSkills: Data Engineering, Data Analysis Consultation, Mixpanel, Data AnalysisCountry: Canada""
